page.title: 13LIFE IN A RIDING SCHOOL
page.content: The stable owner arrives at 6.30am. She feeds, waters and mucks out the stabled horses.Sometimes she puts the horses into a field.She sweeps the yard and at 8.00am friends sometimes come round to help.If they do they get out the school horses from the field. People pay to learn how to ride.The first rides begin at 9.00am and finish at 2.00pm.The horses are taken back to the field.The stable owner then sweeps out the yard and the stables.At about 3.30pm the friends leave and at about 5.30pm the stable owner checks all the horses and then goes home.Later on in the evening she comes back to check all the horses again. It is mostly girls who like to go horse-riding.Most instructors take their pupils out in the country lanes where they ride their horses.Those who have just started ride in a paddock.
